metadata.Title: CVE-2020-35508 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
A flaw possibility of race condition and incorrect initialization of theprocess id was found in the Linux kernel child/parent processidentification handling while filtering signal handlers. A local attackeris able to abuse this flaw to bypass checks to send any signal to aprivileged process.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-35508` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-198.230
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-198.230
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-198.230
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-129.132~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-129.132~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-129.132~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1085.94
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1119.133
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1091.96~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1103.114~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1091.104~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1062.68~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1143-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1143.153
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1147-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1147.157
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-198.230').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-129.132~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1085.94').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1119.133').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1091.96~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1103.114~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1091.104~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1062.68~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1143.153').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1147.157').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
